item.description:
Director, Software Development - GoGrid
Location: San Francisco / SOMA

Our Company
ServePath is a leading Internet services company founded (in 2001), funded and operated by industry veterans who have proven they know how to operate profitable and successful Internet infrastructure companies. We are a leading managed server provider, delivering custom solutions and managed services to businesses that need powerful Internet hosting platforms. Thousands of companies worldwide look to ServePath for its reliability, customization, and speed. We are currently developing some of the most innovative technologies in our space. Most recently we rolled out an On Demand Virtualized Hosting environment called GoGrid. GoGrid is the world's first multi-server control panel that enables you to deploy and manage on demand server hosting from a standard web browser.

We also operate a state-of-the-art 20,000 square foot facility located at 360 Spear and Harrison with offices directly across the street at 345 Spear. This location has good parking and the best public transportation facilities in the Bay Area including BART, Cal Train, the Express Bus terminal, car pool drop-offs, etc, not to mention being able to catch the occasional game at AT&T Park and our scenic views.

Position Description
The Director, Software Development at GoGrid is responsible for:

Software Development
  • Planning and executing projects
  • Develop technical designs
  • Oversee the application development lifecycle
  • Proof of concepts, prototyping
Release/Build
  • Release and builds services
  • Source code control, code line management
  • Development environment setup
  • Staging to operations support
The Director is responsible for defining clear, high-level direction and overseeing team activities. This individual must put in place all of the necessary infrastructure, processes, tools, resources, and people to in order to deliver high quality applications, optimizing performance through experimentation and research, and developing methodologies that optimize on capital and resources while driving faster time to market. The Director is responsible for aligning resources to meet the goals of the group and motivating and inspiring people to overcome obstacles in driving their initiatives to completion. As part of the senior management team in the company, the Director must work effectively with all other organizations to meet the company business goals and reach a high level of customer, shareholder, and employee satisfaction. This position is *not* a pure management position; the Director is expected to contribute technically to their projects.

Job Duties
 Manage the software development process, including task planning and code reviews
 Manages a team of release/builds engineers, including development environment management and production change reviews
 Define and establish processes for how people should work together, within your team, across engineering, and also across company departments
 Demonstrate independence, creativity and initiative and the ability to master a solid understanding of the companys architecture and its business goals.
 Ability to form strong cross-functional relationships to provide the ability to lead a sizable project team, taking the project from start to finish.
 Provides a breadth and depth of understanding system integration and cost/time impact.
 Work closely with product management to ensure we're building the best products
 Document design as needed for internal design reviews and coding
 Motivate and energizing the best engineers, as well as gain their respect
 Advocate team work and help engineers to team together to deliver projects
 Be a key influence to decision-making
 Demonstrate management capabilities to provide guidance and mentorship of others
 Share knowledge with more junior team members via a formal mentoring relationship, reviewing code, reviewing design docs, giving technical talks, teaching classes or as a consultant on projects.
Qualifications
This is a tough job that gives unbeatable experience but we require talented people with a strong work ethic and the following qualifications:

Required
 5 years of experience managing software engineers, developing functional specifications, cost/benefits analysis of projects
 5 years experience using iterative development methods, scrum or XP preferred
 Experience with systems programming  machine control code, etc.
 Experience developing products using server virtualization technologies (Xen, KVM highly preferred)
 10 years expertise with server operating systems (windows and *nix), and all common internet protocols, languages, and applications
 5 years technical project management experience and a proven track record for delivering projects on-time with limited budget and resources
 5 years of experience working with off-shore engineering teams
 Strong distributed systems and architecture knowledge, and experience with multi-tiered mission-critical systems preferred.
 Ability to manage complex technical projects.
 Demonstrates expertise in problem solving and technical innovation.
 Demonstrated experience of delivering on commitments to clients.
 Demonstrates capability of "rolling-up sleeves and getting hands dirty".
 Ability to read and modify Java, Python, and PERL code.
 Works well in fast-paced growing environment.
 May have prior start-up experience and demonstrate ability to adapt.
 Provides excellent influential communication skills and business acumen to both an arbitrator and advocate for technical issues.
 College degree in computer science or engineering (or equivalent experience
 Travel requirements limited to occasional conferences  1-2 weeks per year total
 Additional duties as required from a small, fast growing start-up company
Benefits
We offer a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, basic life/AD&D, alternative medicine program, Health and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts and Employee Assistance Program.

ServePath also offers a 401(k) plan with company matching, 90% subsidized gym membership at the Crunch Fitness downstairs from our office, commuter benefits, employee referral bonuses & recognition programs, auto and pet insurance, game room, Friday lunches, free sodas and fruit, 2 weeks vacation and floating holidays.
